name: FGameplayCueNotify_ForceFeedbackInfo
doc:
FGameplayCueNotify_ForceFeedbackInfo

    Properties that specify how to play a force feedback effect.

SpawnConditionOverride: Condition to check before playing the force feedback.
PlacementInfoOverride: Defines how the force feedback will be placed.
ForceFeedbackTag:
Tag used to identify the force feedback effect so it can later be canceled.
Warning: If this is "None" it will stop ALL force feedback effects if it is canceled.
WorldIntensity: Multiplier applied to the force feedback when played in world.
WorldAttenuation: How the force feedback is attenuated over distance when played in world.
bIsLooping: If enabled, the force feedback will be set to loop.
bOverrideSpawnCondition: If enabled, use the spawn condition override and not the default one.
bOverridePlacementInfo: If enabled, use the placement info override and not the default one.
bPlayInWorld: If enabled, the force feedback will be played in the world and affect all players.
